page.title: 14ECOLOGY
page.content: TREES Trees in this area are mostly coniforous and owned by the Forestry Commision,although some are owned privately.The Forestry Commision plant mainly conifers because they grow quickly.They are beginning to plant more hardwoods such as beech,sycamore, ash and others .These decidious trees attract more wildlife and give more variety.The most popular conifers planted in this area are Sitka Spruce and Lodge Pole Pine.Ninety per cent of the wood is used for paper,and the rest is made into fencing posts and made into building timber. If the mountains around here were not grazed by sheep the lower slopes would be covered by oak forests and the upper slopes would have birch, hazel and rowan growing on them.
